thread.section_title: Arsenal star Alexis Sanchez to play through pain against Manchester City – Metro
thread.title: Arsenal star Alexis Sanchez to play through pain against Manchester City
thread.title_full: Arsenal star Alexis Sanchez to play through pain against Manchester City

author: Coral Barry
title: Arsenal star Alexis Sanchez to play through pain against Manchester City
text:
Alexis Sanchez helped Chile keep their World Cup qualification hopes alive (Picture: Getty) Arsene Wenger has insisted Alexis Sanchez will be able to start against Manchester City on Sunday despite picking up an injury while on international duty.
Wenger fires warning to Chelsea over Sanchez pursuit Sanchez was facing a late fitness test this week after playing 90 minutes for Chile in both their World Cup qualifiers during the international break.
The Arsenal star was believed to have picked up a minor knock, but Wenger says Sanchez can play through the pain.
‘We got a message from him,’ said Wenger about Sanchez’s injury.
Arsenal fixtures Manchester City (H) – Sun 2 Apr
West Ham (H) – Wed 5 Apr
Crystal Palace (A) – Mon 10 Apr
Middlesbrough (A) – Mon 17 Apr
Manchester City (N) FA Cup – Sun 23 Apr
Tottenham (A) – Sun 30 Apr
Manchester United (H) – Sat 6 May
Stoke (A) – Sat 13 May
‘It was a kick. We didn’t know if the ligament was touched or not.
‘Bone bruising. He could normally play.’
&&&&& To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
Sanchez was taken off late in Arsenal’s last game before the international break with Wenger admitting afterwards he should not have allowed him to play the second half against West Brom.
Despite Wenger insisting Sanchez was injured, the attacker played a full part in Chile’s games.
Arsene Wenger says Sanchez will start (Picture: Getty) More: Football Arsene Wenger backtracks and throws his Arsenal future into further doubt 
Revealed: Why Ozil and Sanchez contract talks have been shelved 
Jose Mourinho speaks out over Man United's interest for 'absurd' £173m superstar 
Arsenal welcome City to the Emirates on Sunday in a crucial game in the race for top four.
City are currently seven points ahead of Arsenal in the table with the Gunners in sixth place.
But with two games in hand over Liverpool in fourth, Arsenal will be looking to close the six-point gap between them and the final Champions League spot.
MORE: Arsene Wenger explains why Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez’s Arsenal contract talks are on hold
